summary.title: Juice Shop Lab
summary.description: Local OWASP Juice Shop setup: Node.js 19.0.0 container running the application, user browser accessing via HTTP on port 3000 or optionally through a reverse proxy with TLS and security headers. Persistent storage for logs/uploads. Outbound notifications sent via Email/SMS provider or optional webhooks. Focus on modeling minimal architecture, STRIDE threats, and actionable mitigations.

diagrams.title: diagram
diagrams.description: High-level threat model for local OWASP Juice Shop setup. Shows trust boundaries (Internet → Host → Container network), actors (User Browser, Attacker), components (Juice Shop container, optional reverse proxy, persistent storage, Email/SMS provider), and data flows. STRIDE threats applied to assets and flows to identify risks and mitigations.
